properties.name: Apollo 11
properties.description: First crewed Moon landing. Armstrong and Aldrin spent just over two hours outside, collecting samples, taking photographs, and deploying experiments. The descent stage, flag, and experiment packages remain on the surface.
properties.firstWords: Houston, Tranquility Base here. The Eagle has landed.

properties.name: Apollo 12
properties.description: Precision landing within walking distance of Surveyor 3, which had landed in 1967. Conrad and Bean retrieved parts from Surveyor to study the effects of 2.5 years on the lunar surface.

properties.name: Apollo 14
properties.description: Landing at the site originally intended for Apollo 13. Shepard, the first American in space, became the oldest person to walk on the Moon at 47. He famously hit two golf balls. They came within 20 meters of Cone Crater's rim.

properties.name: Apollo 15
properties.description: First 'J-mission' with extended surface stay and the Lunar Roving Vehicle. Explored Hadley Rille, a sinuous channel 1.5km wide and 300m deep. Found the 'Genesis Rock' (sample 15415), one of the oldest lunar samples. Scott performed the famous hammer-feather drop.

properties.name: Apollo 16
properties.description: Only mission to land in the lunar highlands. Scientists expected volcanic rocks but found impact breccias. Young set the lunar speed record at 18 km/h. Duke left a family photo on the surface.

properties.name: Apollo 17
properties.description: Final Apollo mission and last time humans walked on the Moon. Schmitt was the only professional geologist to visit. Discovered orange soil (volcanic glass beads). Cernan's last words on the surface: 'We leave as we came and, God willing, as we shall return.'
properties.lastWords: We leave as we came and, God willing, as we shall return.
